citation.article-title: Numerical taxonomy of mycobactin-dependent mycobacteria, emended description of Mycobacterium avium, and description of Mycobacterium avium subsp. avium subsp. nov., Mycobacterium avium subsp. paratuberculosis subsp. nov., and Mycobacterium avium subsp. silvaticum subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Mycobacterium avium subsp. silvaticum subsp. nov.

Mycobacterium avium subsp. silvaticum strains possess the properties of M. avium described above and the additional features indicated in Table 2. Inability to grow on egg medium and stimulation of growth at pH 5.5 are characteristic of the subspecies. Strains have not been isolated from the environment, are obligate pathogens for animals, and cause tuberculosis in birds and paratuberculosis in mammals (11, 28, 29, 43). The type strain is strain 6409 (= CIP 103317 [Collection Nationale de Cultures de Microorganismes, Paris, France]).
